record.dc:title: 42BY11 Rymer Site 15BY11, Bradley Co., TN. Feature 18, semi-subterranean structure with central firebasin. Shows dark soil in house pit prior to excavation. Square 13L2. Direction northwest.
record.wpa:narrative: Entrance at SE corner - unburned. Rectangular structure with rounded corners. Central firebasin with raised curb. At southeast corner entrance with wall trenches. Depth of countersink 0.8 to 1.1. Floor higher at firebasin, lower in South side. Floor covered with yellow, weathered clay, apparently fallen from roof, 0.1' to 0.5' deep, mainly concentrated around firebasin. Post molds seem to form pattern of partitions. See special ground plan and note books PP 80, 81.
record.wpa:photograph_category: Structure Patterns; General Site and Excavation
